label: Apple
name: Apple
funfact: Apples are 25% air, which is why they float in water.

benefits.title: Heart Health
benefits.description: Apples may help reduce heart disease risks due to their fiber, flavonoids, and antioxidant properties.

benefits.title: Hydration
benefits.description: Apples are a good source of water, aiding in hydration.

benefits.title: Provides Vitamin C
benefits.description: Apples, rich in vitamin C, bolster the immune system and help ward off illnesses.

label: Banana
name: Banana
funfact: Bananas are berries, while strawberries are not.

benefits.title: Energy Boost
benefits.description: Bananas provide a quick energy boost due to their carbohydrate content.

benefits.title: Heart Health
benefits.description: High in potassium and fiber, bananas support heart health by maintaining healthy blood pressure levels and reducing the risk of stroke.

benefits.title: Better digestion
benefits.description: Bananas, especially the ripe ones, are a good source of dietary fiber, promoting healthy digestion and preventing constipation.

label: Pear
name: Pear
funfact: Pears ripen from the inside out!

benefits.title: Hydration
benefits.description: Pears have high water content, making them hydrating.

benefits.title: Heart Health
benefits.description: The dietary fiber in pears helps lower bad cholesterol levels.

benefits.title: Skin Health
benefits.description: The vitamin C in pears promotes collagen production, leading to healthier skin!

label: Orange
name: Orange
funfact: Oranges are a hybrid, between the pomelo and mandarin.

benefits.title: Immune Boost
benefits.description: Oranges are rich in vitamin C, which helps in strengthening the immune system and fighting off illnesses.

benefits.title: Heart Health
benefits.description: The fiber, potassium, and vitamin C content in oranges support heart health.

benefits.title: Vision Health
benefits.description: Oranges are rich in carotenoids, which are converted to vitamin A and help improve vision!

label: Grapes
name: Grapes
funfact: When grapes are dried, they become raisins. It can take more than 4 pounds of grapes to produce just one pound of raisins.

benefits.title: Heart Health
benefits.description: Grapes, especially the red and purple ones, contain powerful antioxidants known as flavonoids, which can reduce the risk of heart disease.

benefits.title: Brain Health
benefits.description: Resveratrol, a compound found in grapes, has been shown to boost cerebral blood flow and reduce the risk of Alzheimerâ€™s disease.

benefits.title: Antioxidant Rich
benefits.description: Grapes are packed with antioxidants, including vitamin C and selenium, which can help protect the body from harmful free radicals.

label: Lemon
name: Lemon
funfact: Due to their acidic juice, lemons can be used to conduct electricity, effectively serving as a natural battery.

benefits.title: Alkalizing Effect
benefits.description: Grapes, especially the red and purple ones, contain powerful antioxidants known as flavonoids, which can reduce the risk of heart disease.

benefits.title: Vitamin C Boost
benefits.description: Lemons are a great source of vitamin C, which is known to boost the immune system and skin health.

benefits.title: Digestive Aid
benefits.description: Lemon water can aid digestion and encourage the production of bile.

label: Watermelon
name: Watermelon
funfact: Every part of a watermelon is edible, including the rind. In some parts of the world, watermelon rind is pickled or stir-fried.

benefits.title: Hydration
benefits.description: Watermelons help in staying hydrated thanks to their high water content.

benefits.title: Muscle Recovery
benefits.description: Watermelon contains an amino acid called citrulline, which may help reduce muscle soreness and improve recovery time following exercise.

benefits.title: Skin and Hair Health
benefits.description: Vitamin A in watermelon helps in the production and repair of skin cells.

label: Grapefruit
name: Grapefruit
funfact: Despite its name, the grapefruit is not related to grapes. It was named for the way it grows in clusters on trees, similar to grapes.

benefits.title: Energy Boost
benefits.description: Grapefruits provide steady energy due to their low glycemic index.

benefits.title: Heart Health
benefits.description: Grapefruit can benefit heart health by reducing high blood pressure and cholesterol.

benefits.title: Immune Support
benefits.description: Rich in vitamin C, they help protect cells from harmful bacteria and viruses.

label: Avocado
name: Avocado
funfact: An avocado is a berry, and the stone inside is its seed.

benefits.title: Brain Health
benefits.description: Rich in folate, avocados can support cognitive function.

benefits.title: Heart Health
benefits.description: High in monounsaturated fats, they promote healthy cholesterol levels.

benefits.title: Antioxidants
benefits.description: Contain lutein and zeaxanthin, antioxidants are beneficial for eye health.

label: Guava
name: Guava
funfact: Guava leaves can be brewed as a tea and are believed to have medicinal properties.

benefits.title: Immune Boost
benefits.description: High in vitamin C, guavas support a strong immune system.

benefits.title: Heart Health
benefits.description: Rich in dietary fiber and vitamin C, guavas promote healthy heart function.

benefits.title: Skin Health
benefits.description: Vitamin C in guavas aids in collagen production for vibrant skin.

label: Tomato
name: Tomato
funfact: Tomatoes are botanically a fruit, but they're legally considered a vegetable in the U.S. because of a Supreme Court decision in 1893.

benefits.title: Cancer Prevention
benefits.description: Lycopene in tomatoes is linked to reduce certain cancer risks.

benefits.title: Heart Health
benefits.description: Help in lowering bad cholesterol and maintaining blood pressure.

benefits.title: Eye Health
benefits.description: Contains nutrients that protect eye health and vision.

benefits.title: Cancer Prevention
benefits.description: Description.
